definition: pen/pencil/writing brush/to write or compose/the strokes of Chinese characters/classifier for sums of money, deals/CL:支[zhi1],枝[zhi1]

pinyin: du2 li4 Zhong1 wen2 bi3 hui4

sentences.english: Very well written, the book is packed with clever ideas and fascinating information.
sentences.chinese: 這本書有很好的文筆，聰明的想法以及有趣的信息。

sentences.english: Furthermore I style of writing is good, have published in newspapers and periodicals 6 article.
sentences.chinese: 再者，我的文筆較好，曾在報刊上發表過6篇文章。

sentences.english: Be consistent in grammar or punctuation.
sentences.chinese: 在文筆和標點符號上保持一致。

sentences.english: The agricultural student knew animals, but nevertheless his stories were dull and colorlessly written.
sentences.chinese: 這爲農科學生了解動物，但他的文筆單調而毫無色彩。

sentences.english: This is just another legal potboiler.
sentences.chinese: 這是垃圾，雖然文筆太差，不過還算有趣。

sentences.english: He has liked reading since his childhood, so he excels in both writing and debating.
sentences.chinese: 他從小就喜愛閱讀，是以文筆口才都好。

sentences.english: Good plot, great characterization, enticing illustrations.
sentences.chinese: 故事情節很好，文筆細膩，插圖精美。

sentences.english: She writes well, but fails in imagination.
sentences.chinese: 她文筆很好，但寫出的東西缺乏想象力。

sentences.english: The writing stlye is just classic mr.
sentences.chinese: 看這文筆一定是金先生寫的。

sentences.english: His spice blend is a peppery one.
sentences.chinese: 他那辛辣的文筆是麻辣味的。

sentences.english: Good writers can easily interest some people with their words.
sentences.chinese: 文筆好的人很容易用自己的語言引起別人的興趣。

sentences.english: A wonderfully written email, of course.
sentences.chinese: 當然這是一封文筆很好的信。

sentences.english: His style was chastened by study of great writers.
sentences.chinese: 他的文筆因研究了偉大作家的作品而變得洗練。

sentences.english: Vince writes so well; he is a born writer.
sentences.chinese: 文斯的文筆很好，他是個天生的作家。

sentences.english: Plus the authors style of beautiful and read very smooth, very comfortable.
sentences.chinese: 再加上作者的優美文筆，讀起來很順暢，很舒服。

sentences.english: This kind of writing, with its brilliantly allusive language, poses an uncommon challenge to the translator.
sentences.chinese: 這種巧於用典的文筆對翻譯者來說是個不尋常的挑戰。

definition: thought-provoking/worth thinking over/to provide food for thought
word/statement/speech/lyrics/CL:組|组[zu3],個|个[ge4]/a form of lyric poetry, flourishing in the Song dynasty 宋朝|宋朝[Song4 chao2]/CL:首[shou3]
